parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Spack",
  "details": {
    "scheduler": "Slurm",
    "spack_version": "0.17.2",
    "spack_instance": "cpu",
    "spack_instance_dir": "/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.2/cpu",
    "package": "slepc@3.16.0",
    "compiler": "gcc@10.2.0",
    "variants": "~arpack ~blopex ~cuda ~rocm",
    "dependencies": [
      "petsc@3.16.1",
      "openmpi@4.1.3",
      "python@3.8.12"
    ],
    "resources": {
      "nodes": 1,
      "tasks_per_node": 1,
      "cpus_per_task": 16,
      "memory": "32G",
      "time": "00:30:00"
    }
  }
}
```

This script is using **Spack** to install the **SLEPc** package. It utilizes **Slurm** as a scheduler to manage resources and job execution. The script specifies a set of dependencies and variants for the installation of SLEPc, including PETSc, OpenMPI, and Python. It configures various aspects of Spack and utilizes its commands to install the software. The script utilizes Slurm's job dependency feature to schedule the execution of another script, "slepc@3.16.0-cmplx.sh," after the successful installation of SLEPc. The script also uses `time` command to measure the execution time of the `spack install` command.
